About Me

I am a Sr. Software Engineer at Splunk who is passionate about delivering cloud native, highly scalable and reliable products which address pressing needs of the business.

I am most skilled in: AWS Golang Python Terraform GitLab Kubernetes

Global DNS

Global DNS @ Splunk

May 2021 - present

splunk.com

The Domain Name Server (DNS) is the Achilles heel of the Web. The important thing is that it's managed responsibly.

Design, implement and enhance a Global DNS solution which is cloud native, eventually consistent across multiple DNS providers and is fault tolerant across multiple regions. This project involved following technologies:

  • Kubernetes
  • Istio
  • Prometheus/Grafana
  • Micro-services architecture
  • Python
  • Golang
  • AWS
  • GCP
  • DNS
  • Helm
  • Gitlab CI
  • Terraform

Kubernetes Self Service

Invoice2go

Senior DevOps Engineer

May 2020 - May 2021

bill.com

Enable developers to focus on business outcomes

Make a common pattern across organisation to ensure on creating a repositories developer is services with:

  • CI/CD pipeline
  • Code security scans and test report
  • Registry for container images
  • Deployment manifest (kubernetes manifest)
  • Metrics endpoint and dashboards
  • Monitoring (with SLx dashboards and alerts) This involed:
  • Setting up standardising naming conventions across organisations
  • Migrating from Github EE to GitLab EE
  • Setting up linkerd2 cross cluster
  • Setting up cloud native Grafana and Thanos installation on kubernetes
  • standardising EKS upgrades and deployments

Containerization

Invoice2go

Senior DevOps Engineer

Oct 2019 - May 2020

bill.com

DevOps is not just infrastructure engineering. Its a role that evangalizes the platform, develops the platform and enhances the platform

Enahnce the existing setup in Invoice2go from:

  • multi-branch pipelines to single branch pipelines
  • ec2 hosted containers to a proper container orchestration layer The vision was to migrate to EKS based kubernetes platform. The scope of project eventually evolved to include:
  • updating multi-branch deployments to main branch deployments
  • standardising deployment patterns. This involves talking to all the stakeholders and classifying different deployments and making a standard pattern across all the organisation for all the deployments
  • creating release management pipelines for secure and CSI complaint AMIs of EKS nodes
  • migrating all containers to EKS via the new deployment engine

SRE

Splunk

SRE

May 2019 - Oct 2019

splunk.com

Assist in migrating thousands of SplunkCloud customers to a new version of Splunk software with object backed storage. This project involved working at massive scale to make sure migration process with multiple touchpoints is completely automated, seemless and massively scalable. It involved scripting in Golang, writing custom terraform modules, coordinating with multiple teams and mentoring folks to upskill in coding and AWS.

Sr Consultant

Sr Infrastructure Consultant

Sr Infrastructure Consultant

May 2018 - May 2019

https://www.cmdsolutions.com.au/

This was the biggest learning curve for me as we were invested in creating cookie-cutter patterns for various start-ups to make sure they get highly compliant AWS landing zones up in a matter of hours rather than days.

Did multiple projects on AWS to migrate customers from on-premise. This involed following technolgies and competence:

Consultant

Consultant @ Qantas

Consultant

Jan 2010 - May 2018

https://www.qantas.com.au/

Started my tenure with on-prem Middleware technologies, and sloly progressed to manage multiple Middleware technologies including:

  • WebLogic Servers
  • Web Servers
  • MQ Servers

Eventually I was busy with PoC on AWS for cost saving opportunities which is when I started working in Center of Excelence for Cloud. Where I was part of the team which built Qantas Cloud Platform - an ecapsulation over a public Cloud with other enabling technologies wrapped in including:

  • Atlassian Suite
  • Proxy servers
  • Splunk
  • CSI compliant AMIs
  • AD Services
  • Content Management Platform, etc.
